items.title: Manchester synagogue attack: what do we know so far?
items.standfirst: Attack at Heaton Park synagogue that killed two people has been declared a terrorist incidentAt 9.31am on Thursday, a member of the public rang the police saying they had witnessed “a car being driven towards members of the public, and one man had been stabbed” outside Heaton Park shul, a synagogue in Crumpsall, Manchester, where people had gathered to observe Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish faith. Continue reading...
items.content: Attack at Heaton Park synagogue that killed two people has been declared a terrorist incidentAt 9.31am on Thursday, a member of the public rang the police saying they had witnessed “a car being driven towards members of the public, and one man had been stabbed” outside Heaton Park shul, a synagogue in Crumpsall, Manchester, where people had gathered to observe Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish faith. Continue reading...

items.title: UK police release names of the 2 victims of the Manchester synagogue attack
items.standfirst: Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serious condition.
items.content: Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serious condition.(Image credit: Peter Byrne/)

items.title: Two killed in UK synagogue 'terrorist attack' on 'holiest day'
items.standfirst: Two people were killed on Thursday and four wounded when a man ploughed a car into a crowd outside a packed Manchester synagogue on a sombre Jewish holiday and then embarked on a stabbing spree. Police said they shot dead the suspect and arrested two other people within hours of the attack which occurred as Jewish communities around the world marked Yom Kippur, the holiest holiday in the Jewish calendar. Story by Daniel Quinlan.
items.content: Two people were killed on Thursday and four wounded when a man ploughed a car into a crowd outside a packed Manchester synagogue on a sombre Jewish holiday and then embarked on a stabbing spree. Police said they shot dead the suspect and arrested two other people within hours of the attack which occurred as Jewish communities around the world marked Yom Kippur, the holiest holiday in the Jewish calendar. Story by Daniel Quinlan.

items.title: 2 killed in terrorist attack at Manchester synagogue on Yom Kippur
items.standfirst: Police say a suspect rammed a car into people gathered outside a synagogue in the English city of Manchester, before getting out and stabbing people. The suspect is a 35-year-old British citizen of Syrian descent, according to police. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
items.content: Police say a suspect rammed a car into people gathered outside a synagogue in the English city of Manchester, before getting out and stabbing people. The suspect is a 35-year-old British citizen of Syrian descent, according to police. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.

items.title: U.K. police declare Manchester synagogue attack 'a terrorist incident'
items.standfirst: Greater Manchester Police Chief Constable Sir Stephen Watson officially declared that the attack at a synagogue in Manchester was a "terrorist incident." The investigation is now being led by counter terrorist police. Two members of Manchester's Jewish community died in the synagogue attack, with others still recovery from their injuries.
items.content: Greater Manchester Police Chief Constable Sir Stephen Watson officially declared that the attack at a synagogue in Manchester was a "terrorist incident." The investigation is now being led by counter terrorist police. Two members of Manchester's Jewish community died in the synagogue attack, with others still recovery from their injuries.

items.title: Two killed in car ramming and stabbing outside U.K. synagogue in a 'terrorist incident'
items.standfirst: Police declared a terrorist incident after two people were killed and three others were seriously injured when a man rammed a car into a crowd and stabbed people at an Orthodox synagogue.
items.content: Police declared a terrorist incident after two people were killed and three others were seriously injured when a man rammed a car into a crowd and stabbed people at an Orthodox synagogue.

ai_summary: Two men, Adrian Daulby and Melvin Cravitz, were killed in the Manchester synagogue attack.
One victim was reportedly shot dead by police officers at the scene.
The attack occurred outside a synagogue where people were observing Yom Kippur.
Three others remain hospitalized in serious condition following the attack.
The incident has been declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

clusters.title: Munich airport resumes flights after drone sightings trigger closure
clusters.neutral_headline: Munich Airport Reopens After Drone Sightings

items.title: Munich airport resumes flights after drone sightings trigger closure
items.standfirst: Germany's Munich airport restarted flights on Friday after several drone sightings forced its closure overnight, the latest in a string of similar aviation disruptions across Europe. Airports in Denmark, Norway and Poland have recently suspended flights due to unidentified drones, while Romania and Estonia have pointed the finger at Russia, which has brushed off the allegations. Story by Liza Kaminov.
items.content: Germany's Munich airport restarted flights on Friday after several drone sightings forced its closure overnight, the latest in a string of similar aviation disruptions across Europe. Airports in Denmark, Norway and Poland have recently suspended flights due to unidentified drones, while Romania and Estonia have pointed the finger at Russia, which has brushed off the allegations. Story by Liza Kaminov.

items.title: Munich airport reopens after halting flights because of drone sightings
items.standfirst: Travel disrupted for thousands on eve of national holiday in latest drone incident to hit European aviationMunich airport has reopened after drone sightings over the facility on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers in the German city on the eve of a national holiday.A further 15 arriving flights were diverted to Stuttgart, Nuremberg, Vienna and Frankfurt, the airport said in a statement, marking the latest drone disruption to European aviation after sightings temporarily shut airports last week in Denmark and Norway. Continue reading...
items.content: Travel disrupted for thousands on eve of national holiday in latest drone incident to hit European aviationMunich airport has reopened after drone sightings over the facility on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers in the German city on the eve of a national holiday.A further 15 arriving flights were diverted to Stuttgart, Nuremberg, Vienna and Frankfurt, the airport said in a statement, marking the latest drone disruption to European aviation after sightings temporarily shut airports last week in Denmark and Norway. Continue reading...

items.content: Dozens of flights were cancelled or redirected at Munich International Airport after drone sightings.

The disruption in Munich is the latest in a string of similar drone incidents in Europe.
items.content: Germany's Munich airport reopened on Friday after several drone sightings on Thursday evening forced air traffic control to suspend operations, leading to the cancellation of 17 flights and disrupting travel for nearly 3,000 passengers. The disruption in Munich is the latest in a string of similar drone incidents in Europe.

ai_summary: Munich airport reopened after drone sightings forced its closure on Thursday evening.

Fifteen arriving flights were diverted to other airports.
Similar drone incidents have disrupted air travel in Denmark and Norway.
The airport closure occurred on the eve of a national holiday.

items.title: Taylor Swift enters new era with 12th album ‘The Life of a Showgirl’
items.standfirst: Taylor Swift released her 12th studio album, "The Life of a Showgirl", on Friday, marking a return to glittering pop. The 35-year-old teamed up again with Swedish producers Max Martin and Shellback, whose signature beats and hooks drive the hotly anticipated record of love, success and revenge.

clusters.title: Last Gaza Flotilla boat ‘still sailing strong’

items.title: Last Gaza Flotilla boat ‘still sailing strong’
items.standfirst: The Marinette is the last vessel of the Global Sumud Flotilla still heading towards Gaza.
items.content: The Marinette is the last vessel of the Global Sumud Flotilla still heading towards Gaza.

items.title: Last Gaza flotilla boat intercepted by Israel, organisers say
items.standfirst: The last remaining vessel of the Gaza-bound Global Sumud Flotilla was intercepted by Israel on Friday, according to its organisers. The flotilla – consisting of dozens of ships – set sail last month, ferrying politicians, activists and aid towards Gaza before the Israeli navy began intercepting the vessels on Wednesday.
items.content: The last remaining vessel of the Gaza-bound Global Sumud Flotilla was intercepted by Israel on Friday, according to its organisers. The flotilla – consisting of dozens of ships – set sail last month, ferrying politicians, activists and aid towards Gaza before the Israeli navy began intercepting the vessels on Wednesday.

items.title: Israel stops 41 boats in aid flotilla with one ‘still sailing strong’
items.standfirst: Activists from Global Sumud flotilla including Greta Thunberg arrested as final boat is presumed intercepted in Palestinian watersIsrael says it has stopped a pro-Palestinian flotilla carrying aid from reaching Gaza, with its navy intercepting all but one of the vessels trying to breach the blockade.Of the 42 vessels being tracked online by the Global Sumud flotilla (GSF), 41 were listed as having been confirmed or assumed to have been stopped by Israeli forces. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Cyberattack could leave Japan without its most popular beer
clusters.neutral_headline: Japan Could Run Out of Asahi Beer Due to Cyberattack

items.title: Cyberattack could leave Japan without its most popular beer
items.standfirst: Japan could soon be running out of Asahi, the East Asian nation’s most popular beer, following a devastating cyberattack Monday that has brought its factories to a halt.
items.content: Japan could soon be running out of Asahi, the East Asian nation’s most popular beer, following a devastating cyberattack Monday that has brought its factories to a halt.

items.title: Japan days away from running out of Asahi Super Dry due to cyber attack – reports
items.standfirst: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry. Continue reading...
items.content: The attack forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing its signature beerThe Asahi group, Japan’s biggest brewery, is reportedly just days away from running out of its most popular beer, as it struggles to recover from a cyber-attack that caused a system outage.The ransomware attack, reported on Monday, forced the company to halt production at most of its 30 factories nationwide, including those producing it signature mass-market lager Asahi Super Dry. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Russia's 'shadow fleet' of aging tankers avoiding Western sanctions
clusters.neutral_headline: French Authorities Detain Russian Oil Tanker, Captain Faces Trial

items.title: Russia's 'shadow fleet' of aging tankers avoiding Western sanctions
items.standfirst: The captain of an oil tanker that authorities in France have detained off the country's Atlantic coast and which President Emmanuel Macron has linked to Russia will go on trial in February over the crew’s alleged refusal to cooperate, a French prosecutor said Thursday. Macron has alleged that the tanker belongs to Russia’s so-called shadow fleet of aging tankers of uncertain ownership that are avoiding Western sanctions over Moscow’s war in Ukraine, and he didn't rule out that it could have been involved in drone flights over Denmark as it was sailing last week off the coast of the Nordic country. Story by Eliza Herbert.
items.content: The captain of an oil tanker that authorities in France have detained off the country's Atlantic coast and which President Emmanuel Macron has linked to Russia will go on trial in February over the crew’s alleged refusal to cooperate, a French prosecutor said Thursday. Macron has alleged that the tanker belongs to Russia’s so-called shadow fleet of aging tankers of uncertain ownership that are avoiding Western sanctions over Moscow’s war in Ukraine, and he didn't rule out that it could have been involved in drone flights over Denmark as it was sailing last week off the coast of the Nordic country. Story by Eliza Herbert.

items.title: Russia-linked oil tanker stopped by France resumes voyage, according to vessel trackers
items.standfirst: The Boracay, a tanker from Russia's "shadow fleet" that was detained by the French navy, resumed its journey towards the Suez Canal, data from maritime websites Marine Traffic and Vesselfinder showed Friday. Russian President Vladimir Putin denounced the tanker's detention as an act of piracy and alleged that Paris had initiated the move for domestic policy reasons.
items.content: The Boracay, a tanker from Russia's "shadow fleet" that was detained by the French navy, resumed its journey towards the Suez Canal, data from maritime websites Marine Traffic and Vesselfinder showed Friday. Russian President Vladimir Putin denounced the tanker's detention as an act of piracy and alleged that Paris had initiated the move for domestic policy reasons.

He also did not rule out that it could have been involved in drone flights over Denmark as it was sailing last week off the coast of the Nordic country. Continue reading...

He also did not rule out that it could have been involved in drone flights over Denmark as it was sailing last week off the coast of the Nordic country. Continue reading...

The tanker was detained off France's coast and linked to Russia's "shadow fleet."
President Macron suggested the tanker might have been involved in drone flights over Denmark.
The tanker, Boracay, resumed its journey towards the Suez Canal after detention.
Vladimir Putin called the detention an act of piracy, citing domestic policy reasons.

clusters.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
clusters.neutral_headline: Treasure Hunters Recover $1 Million in Coins off Florida

items.title: Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast
items.standfirst: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...
items.content: Valuables were being transported in 1715 from American colonies when a hurricane wrecked a Spanish fleetHidden beneath the turquoise waters off a stretch of Florida known as the “treasure coast”, a team of divers from a shipwreck salvage company have uncovered exactly that – a load of long-lost Spanish treasure they estimate is worth $1m.More than 1,000 silver and gold coins thought to be minted in the Spanish colonies where Bolivia, Mexico and Peru now sit were uncovered this summer off Florida’s Atlantic coast, 1715 Fleet-Queens Jewels LLC announced this week. Continue reading...

items.title: $1M worth of coins recovered in Spanish shipwreck off Florida coast, treasure hunters say
items.standfirst: More than 1,000 silver and gold coins collectively valued at about $1 million were recovered from an 18th-century shipwreck off the coast of Florida, a shipwreck salvage company said
items.content: More than 1,000 silver and gold coins collectively valued at about $1 million were recovered from an 18th-century shipwreck off the coast of Florida, a shipwreck salvage company said

ai_summary: Treasure hunters discovered silver and gold coins off the Florida coast.
The coins are from a Spanish shipwreck dating back to the 1700s.
The recovered coins are estimated to be worth approximately $1 million.
The coins were minted in Spanish colonies, including Bolivia and Mexico.
The treasure was found by a shipwreck salvage company.

clusters.title: OpenAI’s Sora 2 lets users insert themselves into AI videos with sound
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI's Sora App Allows Users to Insert Themselves in Videos

items.title: OpenAI’s Sora 2 lets users insert themselves into AI videos with sound
items.standfirst: Sora social app launches with deepfake-style "cameos" and feed controls.
items.content: On Tuesday, OpenAI announced Sora 2, its second-generation video-synthesis AI model that can now generate videos in various styles with synchronized dialogue and sound effects, which is a first for the company. OpenAI also launched a new iOS social app that allows users to insert themselves into AI-generated videos through what OpenAI calls "cameos." OpenAI showcased the new model in an AI-generated video that features a photorealistic version of OpenAI CEO Sam Altman talking to the camera in a slightly unnatural-sounding voice amid fantastical backdrops, like a competitive ride-on duck race and a glowing mushroom garden. Regarding that voice, the new model can create what OpenAI calls "sophisticated background soundscapes, speech, and sound effects with a high degree of realism." In May, Google's Veo 3 became the first video-synthesis model from a major AI lab to generate synchronized audio as well as video. Just a few days ago, Alibaba released Wan 2.5, an open-weights video model that can generate audio as well. Now OpenAI has joined the audio party with Sora 2.Read full article Comments

items.standfirst: OpenAI’s latest app encourages users to generate a personal digital avatar and scroll AI-generated videos of themselves and their friends.
items.content: OpenAI’s latest app encourages users to generate a personal digital avatar and scroll AI-generated videos of themselves and their friends.

ai_summary: OpenAI's new Sora app lets users create AI videos featuring themselves.
The app allows users to generate a personal digital avatar.
Users can scroll AI-generated videos of themselves and friends.
The app encourages users to generate a personal digital avatar.
The app has deepfake-style "cameos" and feed controls.
